adrFormatAddress: 4 South St LL Space 206, New York, NY 10004, USA

editorialSummary.text: Italian ices & frozen custards star at this counter-serve chain with a range of other cold treats.

originalText.text: Ordered a Reese's mudslide concrete. Vanilla ice cream and Skippy peanut butter blended. No chocolate pieces or anything. Looks nothing like the advertised photo above the register. When I asked them about it, and brought up that you're using a brand name and none of the branded item, that's false advertising. They shrugged and said that's how they do it here.

text.text: Ordered a Reese's mudslide concrete. Vanilla ice cream and Skippy peanut butter blended. No chocolate pieces or anything. Looks nothing like the advertised photo above the register. When I asked them about it, and brought up that you're using a brand name and none of the branded item, that's false advertising. They shrugged and said that's how they do it here.

originalText.text: Came all the way down from Harlem for them to be out of chocolate custard. Nothing special, just the basic soft serve that I thought would never be out of stock. There are hundreds of ice cream shops in the city but we chose Rita's because we were craving frozen custard, and Rita's in Connecticut has never disappointed. It was definitely a bummer. The staff were friendly, though.

text.text: Came all the way down from Harlem for them to be out of chocolate custard. Nothing special, just the basic soft serve that I thought would never be out of stock. The staff were friendly, though.

originalText.text: THIS PLACE IS ABSOLUTELY FILTHY ABD DISGUISTINGGGG. I GOT AN ICEE AND IT HAD 2 not 1 ROACHES INSIDE OF IT. ABSOLUTELY DISGUSTED. I WILL BE REPORTING THIS RESTAURANT AND THEY NEED A HEALTH INSPECTION. I WILL SLANDER THIS LOCATION ON ALL SOCIAL MEDIA PLATFORMS. JUST SEE THE DISGUSTING PICTURE BELLOW

originalText.text: I was worried that they weren’t participating in the free First Day of Spring ice, but they were! Made me happy since all the other NYC locations are still closed for the season. They didn’t advertise it or have the special cups, probably because it’s in a location with a lot of foot traffic and they didn’t want to cause a huge line, but they still were giving it to people who asked.

originalText.text:
Please don't come here for Ice Cream.  This was a live-and-learn situation for us during our stay in lower Manhattan.

My girlfriend and I were looking to get frozen custard.  We came upon this vendor situated inside the Staten Island Ferry terminal, sharing a spot with Subway sandwiches.  In fact, the person who served us the Rita's Ice Cream was a Subway sandwich worker.  I suppose the clerks behind the counter manage both franchises.

In any event, both our custards were sloppily dispensed inside waffle cones, not completely filled, and we ended up getting charged nearly $20.  It was just a complete tourist rip-off.

Then we walk out into the area surrounding the South Ferry terminal station where there were several  Ice Cream trucks selling larger cones for only $5.

Just do yourself a favor and avoid this expensive tourist trap and the clerks who don't care enough to give you a good-sized portion cone when their company is vastly overcharging.
